Posts.Content: I too scream in silence but I have been very active in raising money for cancer research since my mother's death in 2005. Now my daughter was just diagnosed with invasive ductal carcinoma. I hope that after this initial feeling of devestation, I will go on raising money for more research. Hope you find a way to direct your grief.
Posts.Title: the battle lost...now what

Posts.Content: My 42 yr old daughter exercises daily, is very health aware, doesn't smoke or drink. Her father's half sister had breat cancer in her late 60's after yrs of HRT. No other risk factors and still she has cancer. It isn't the patient's fault as you seem to suggest.
Posts.Title: Diet link to breast cancer: research

Posts.Content: How old were you when dx'd? My daughter is 42. Anyone out there premenopausal? What treatments do they use for this situation -premeno, HER 2+++ PR+ ER+ - stil underin going more momos and sonos. Doc (surgeron) says surgery, chemo and radiation
